dict.string: Adds a new to-do to Things 3.
on alfred_script(q) tell application "Things3.app" parse quicksilver input q end tell end alfred_script

# Syntax title #tag1 #tag2 [project name/area name] ::note >duedate
# Notes - Only existing tags can be added. This parameter is case-insensitive. If #tag1 doesn’t exist, '#tag1' will be added to the to-do’s title. - To-dos can only be added to existing projects or areas. This parameter is case-insensitive. Projects or areas that don’t already exist will be ignored entirely; the text won’t be added to the to-do’s title. - Format for the due date will reflect your Mac’s short date format. Check this in System Preferences > Language & Region > Advanced… > Dates. Invalid due date formats will result in the parameter’s text being added to the to-dos title. - If you’re using a dark theme for Alfred, there’s a white Inbox icon available in this Workflow’s folder. Right-click the Workflow and click Show in Finder to find it.
